At Municipal State Hospital No. 1 in this steel-making town, local residents are forced to wait up to 12 hours for a computer lung scan - to check for Covid-19 damage - in a crowded, closely packed, reception area, many of them coughing and sneezing. The hospital is overwhelmed.

The upshot: Many are left to fend for themselves for treatment, turning to pharmacies, and paying out of pocket, for medicines that can run from 5,000-10,000 rubles ($68-$137). The average Russian pension is around $200 a month. Those lacking resources, go without medicine.

There simply aren‚Äôt enough doctors here to handle the overflow. As for medicine, the state health care system is supposed to provide needed medicines to the sick. In fact, those who show up at hospitals requesting such medicine are often told they are all out.

The fact is, though doctors are technically supposed to make home visits for those too ill or weak to leave their homes, the reality is a stark contrast: one can literally die waiting for a home doctor visit. In Nizhny Tagil, they rarely happen.

In many cases, town residents are left with no choice but to ride out the virus at home. Trying to get through to a doctor on busy phone lines is often an exercise in futility. Those who are lucky enough to do so are often told they‚Äôll have to wait up to 10 days to see a doctor.

Beyond Moscow: On Friday, #Russian authorities confirmed 28,137 #coronavirus cases & 560 deaths. But official figures fail to convey the magnitude of #Covid19 mismanagement, especially here in provincial cities such as #NizhnyTagil (pop. 350K), in the Urals mountain region.

In 2016, #Sanders beat Clinton by a 3-to-1 margin in the #NewHampshirePrimary among independent voters - those who don‚Äôt align with either major party. Sanders is counting on independents again in 2020. They account for some 42% of the state‚Äôs registered voters. #F24

In the #NewHampshirePrimary, balloting is more straightforward than in Iowa‚Äôs chaotic caucus: the candidate who scores the most votes wins. NH has 24 delegates to allot, divvied up proportionally. The catch: only candidates who get more than 15% of the votes, get delegates. #F24
